list.description: For my internship in the 6th year of high school, I interned at Advionics. Here, I created a program that automatically takes pictures of the product using three different cameras just before it gets packed for shipping. The photos are then saved in a PDF on a server. For this, I used Python and OpenCV for image processing. I didn't learn either at school, but I taught myself.
For my student job, I worked at Advionics. Here, I helped measure their machines that calibrate equipment. For example, I measured the margin of error for each machine.

In this student job, I again worked at Advionics. I was tasked with reading multiple heat sensors and taking certain actions if the temperature was too high or too low. I wrote a program for this in Python.
I worked again at Advionics. Here, I helped rewrite their test software. It was written in Python using Flask. I also ensured this project was containerized with Docker.

text.intro: Here are some projects I've worked on. Some of them are open source, others are not.
text.end: I mostly work on larger projects, most of them included here. I also build smaller projects, but I don't share them here.

popaloon.content1: "Pop-a-loon" is a Chrome extension that I built that occasionally lets a balloon float across the screen. When you click on the balloon, it pops and disappears. The amount of balloons you've popped is displayed in the extension's popup.
popaloon.content2: The extension's popup also contains a leaderboard, where you can see the top 10 balloon poppers.

popaloonBackend.content1: This is the backend API for the Pop-a-loon Chrome extension. It's built with Node.js and Express. It uses a MongoDB database to store the amount of balloons popped by each user.
popaloonBackend.content2: I'm hosting and managing the server myself. The server is behind a reverse proxy, which is managed by Nginx.

finalProject.title: Final Project
finalProject.content: For my final project in high school (2022 - 2023), I built a bluetooth detection system that can locate bluetooth devices in a room. Detected devices get send via http to a server (Raspberry Pi). The server then calculates the location of the found device in a room. This information is then displayed via websocket in a React app. It has an advanced structure to make it easy to add new features.

discordBot.title: Discord Bot
discordBot.content: I built a discord bot with node.js and discord.js. It's written in TypeScript and uses a MongoDB database.
